alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 15 at 9:39PM CST until December 15 at 10:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN CLARK AND SOUTHEASTERN TAYLOR COUNTIES... At 939 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Dorchester, or 9 miles southwest of Medford, moving northeast at 110 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Clark and southeastern Taylor Counties, including the following locations... Curtiss, The Taylor County Airport, Stetsonville, Atwood, Withee, County Roads A And E and Esadore Lake. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
